summary: Over this 6‑hour window winds averaged about 13.5 m/s with low short‑term variability (std ~1.3) but included a large spike to 44 m/s; despite those conditions, power was low on average and highly variable (mean ~0.30, std ~0.45) with a sizable negative residual (~-0.63) indicating consistent underproduction versus expected output. Rotational speeds were notably variable (rotor rpm std ~6.9; generator rpm std ~769), pitch angle averaged high (~63.8°), yaw misalignment averaged ~8.3°, all status indicators were non‑normal throughout the window, and temperatures averaged ~61.1°C.
